Data Science from Scratch

This document, "Data Science from Scratch," is presented as a comprehensive guide for individuals seeking to learn data science fundamentals. It‚Äôs positioned as "The #1 Data Science Guide for Everything," aiming to equip readers with the knowledge and skills necessary to become proficient in the field. The guide covers a broad range of topics, starting with an introduction to data science, its importance, and the key differences between data science and big data. It delves into the data science process, outlining the responsibilities and qualifications of a data scientist, and explores the critical role of ‚Äòhacking‚Äô and coding. The book then systematically introduces essential tools and technologies, including Python, SQL, R, SAS, Java, Scala, and Julia, emphasizing practical coding skills. A significant portion is dedicated to data manipulation and cleaning, covering techniques like data rescaling and using libraries such as Pandas. The guide progresses to building predictive models and introduces machine learning and analytics concepts, including linear algebra, statistical distributions, and algorithms like decision trees and neural networks. Furthermore, it addresses scalable data processing, exploring technologies like Apache Hadoop, Apache Storm, Apache Samza, Apache Spark, and Apache Flink, highlighting batch and stream processing systems. The document concludes with a summary of data science applications and provides a section on the author and references. The copyright information indicates the publication year is 2018, and is attributed to Steven Cooper. The overall aim is to provide a foundational understanding of data science, equipping readers with the skills to tackle real-world data challenges. It's structured as a practical guide, emphasizing hands-on learning and the application of various tools and techniques.

Key Concepts:

  • Data Science and its Importance
  • The Process of Data Science
  • Responsibilities of a Data Scientist
  • Data Cleaning and Munging
  • Data Manipulation
  • Data Rescaling
  • Machine Learning and Analytics
  • Scalable Data Processing
  • Data science as a 'fourth paradigm' of science.
  • Unification of statistics, machine learning, data analysis, and other related methods.
